Module kivakit.resource
Package com.telenav.kivakit.resource

Interface ResourcePathed

All Superinterfaces:
UriIdentified
All Known Subinterfaces:
FileService, FileSystemObjectService, FolderService, Resource, ResourceFolder<T>, WritableResource
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseReadableResource, BaseWritableResource, File, FileName, FilePath, Folder, InputResource, LocalFile, LocalFolder, NullResource, OutputResource, Package, PackagePath, PackageResource, ResourcePath, ResourceSection, StringOutputResource, StringResource, ZipEntry
public interface ResourcePathed extends UriIdentified
An object which has a ResourcePath, as returned by path(). Convenience methods provide access to the path's filename and extension(s).

Properties

  • path()
  • uri()
  • url()

Matching

  • matches(Matcher)

File Names

  • baseFileName()
  • compoundExtension()
  • extension()
  • fileName()
  • hasExtension(Extension)

Conversions

  • asJavaFile()
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default File
    asJavaFile()
    Returns this path as a java.io.File
    default FileName
    baseFileName()
    Returns the base name of the file name of this object
    default Extension
    compoundExtension()
    Returns the compound extension of this file named object (for example, ".xml", ".osm.pbf" or ".txd.gz")
    default Extension
    extension()
    Returns the extension of this resource
    default FileName
    fileName()
    Returns the file name of this resource
    default boolean
    hasExtension(@NotNull Extension extension)
    Returns true if this resource ends with the given extension
    default boolean
    matches(@NotNull com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.comparison.Matcher<String> matcher)
    Returns true if the resource path matches the given matcher
    ResourcePath
    path()
    Returns the path for this object
    default URI
    uri()
    Returns the Universal Resource Identifier (URI) for this object
    default URL
    url()
    Returns the path for this object as a URL
